text: - [Kenneth] Welcome to this demonstration,

where we'll explore how
organizations can use services
like AWS Marketplace foundation models,
such as Stable Diffusion by Stability AI,

and Jurassic-Two by AI21
Labs to generate content

that can address a variety
of business use cases
from simple text and image creation,
to assisting with advertising campaigns

and creating interactive
eBooks for children.
Before we dive into the demonstration,
let's take a look at the architecture
behind the application we'll be using.

Some key points to notice
are that third party,
AWS Marketplace foundation models,
will be hosted in SageMaker endpoints.

And the end users will
access the application
that uses several services,

which will then access
the foundation models
running on the SageMaker endpoints.

Some of the services
the application will use

include Amazon API
Gateway for web endpoints,
which is secured by Amazon Cognito.
It will then use AWS Lambda for Business

and Operational Logic, and
finally, Amazon S3 for storage,

and Amazon Polly to transform
text into audio files.

Here's a simpler architecture
where we have users.
We'll connect to an application,
and then that application will interact

with the foundation models
running on SageMaker endpoints.

Let's switch to the sample
application we just described
in the previous diagram.

Now let's move into the
first demonstration.

To start, I'll enter a
prompt to create a poem.
That will be sent to the Jurassic LLM.

Then I'll copy the poem
and select the image tab.

I'll paste some of the poem
text as an image prompt,
and while that is being processed,
I'll move to the audio tab,

paste the poem into the
audio tab, and submit it.

I'll just crop some of
this text for the image.
Then I will submit it.
And now let's go over to the audio tab.
Once in the audio tab,

I'll paste the poem into the
audio prompt and submit it.

An audio file is then created
with the contents of the poem.
If we move back to the image tab,
we'll see the image that was created.
You've just been shown how AWS Marketplace
generative AI models can be utilized

to swiftly generate
text content for a poem.

create an image using some of
the poem's text, and finally,
use Amazon Polly to generate an audio file
of the poem's text.

Now let's look at a more
complex demonstration.

For the next demonstration,
we'll enter more complex prompt
to be sent to Jurassic.

We'll ask the LLM to create
a bedtime story about friends
in Fairyland and format it in JSON format.
Once we have submitted the prompt,

the story will soon be
returned in JSON key pair
or JSON format.
Now we'll copy the JSON output
and go over to the application tab,
where we will submit it as a prompt.
The system will queue it up for processing

and provide us a link
when it is completed.
Bear in mind that while the examples
in this demonstrations are simple,

it is up to your use case
and your imagination.

Behind the scenes, the image
language module is being used
and also Amazon Polly.
Clicking on the completed link,

we can now see, read, and
hear the interactive book.
The book URL can be shared with kids,

where they can enjoy a unique
bedtime story every time.

The app can also be used for
any other business use case,

such as marketing campaign,
instruction manual,
language translation.

The limit is only your
imagination, and your use cases.

What you've just witnessed
is a demonstration

of the dynamic image text
and audio generation process
using Amazon SageMaker and Polly,

in collaboration with
Stability AI's Stable Diffusion
and AI21 Jurassic.
We initialized the content creation
by using a simple text prompt,
and then viewing the content created.
Thank you for watching,
and now it's your turn to give it a try.
